article.headline: Appalachian St. 82, Virginia-Wise 77
article.story: BOONE, N.C. (AP) -- Kellen Brand scored 17 points and combined with Ryann Abraham to hit four straight free throws in the closing seconds as Appalachian State held off Virginia-Wise 82-77 on Monday. The Mountaineers trailed by five points in the first half and had to withstand a second-half rally to avoid an upset loss to their NAIA opponent. Jarrod Soles' jumper with 20 seconds left cut Appalachian's lead to 78-75. Brand then hit two free throws and after Bryan Sexton's layup with 5 seconds left, Abraham hit two free throws to put it away. Eduardo Bermudez added 12 points and Jeremy Clayton grabbed 14 rebounds for Appalachian State (4-5), which overcame 16 turnovers by hitting 29 of 34 free throws. Pance Kecev scored 20 points and Adam Hood added 16 for the Highland Cavaliers (6-8), who hit 13 of 34 3-pointers.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
